author: marioevz
content: Hot fix for blockchain tests is out: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/pectra-devnet-3%40v1.3.0

author: marioevz
content:
One more release for today: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/releases/tag/pectra-devnet-3%40v1.4.0

Fixes expectation on some tests with invalid authorization list signatures.

author: estmcmxci
content: <@892053833121923094> quick question: aside from understanding python, what other prerequisites should a test writer have to effectively generate tests?

author: marioevz
content: Do you mean like generating the fixtures or writing the test cases?

author: estmcmxci
content: either; i want to understand what skillset is necessary to carry out an execution spec test from start to finish, and what a testwriter should expect in terms of time commitment, etc.

author: marioevz
content:
I'd say that EVM (Ethereum Virtual Machine) knowledge is extremely important, and the time commitment really depends on the EIP, it could be one week for a [simple EIP](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-5656), but some can take [months even](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7692).
Take a look into the implemented tests here: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/tree/main/tests they are categorized into forks and then EIPs, so you can get an idea of the complexity difference
